## Introduction

This is an annotated and embedded list of documents that I have gathered on various aspects of TRIZ. All downloadable, in the interest of spreading TRIZ awareness!

Let me place my TRIZ Talk here first!!

{{< video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fwt4NcfefNE >}}

### Books by G. S. Altshuller. 

1. Altshuller G.S. <u>[*THE ART OF INVENTING - AND SUDDENLY THE INVENTOR APPEARED*](https://library.lol/main/8EEDC7B5ABAC7A453CD79A71C0B12B59)</u>. Moscow: Detskaya Literatura, 1989 (1st ed.-1984; 2nd ed.-1987; 3rd ed.- 1989). ISBN 5-08-000598-X.

>This book was written in a popular manner and was aimed at teenagers. In this book, a reader can study 78 real inventive problems and learn to apply 27 practical tools and techniques to solve the problems presented. Book includes some advises for future inventors.

2. Altshuller, G.S. (1984). <u>[*Creativity as an Exact Science: The Theory of the Solution of Inventive Problems*](https://library.lol/main/8E4F8A71C889CA30003D21D644195FCC)</u>. Gordon and Breach Science Publishers, New York.
> This book includes descriptions of 70 inventive problems, ARIZ-77 and several examples of solving problems with a new version of ARIZ.

> The book presents a system of the Laws of Evolution of Technical Systems, the first version of Inventive Rules (Standards), and the principles of Su-Field analysis.

> Book also includes 40 Inventive principles and articles about their evolution, the articles about S-curve life line of systems, the articles about approaches to scientific problem solving, and a table of using several physical effects for inventive problem solving. 

3. Altshuller, G.S. (1999) <u>[*The Innovation Algorithm: TRIZ, Systematic Innovation, and Technical Creativity*](https://library.lol/main/71BF1D23C6AB2A5896E1B4441F628AFE)</u>. Technical Innovation Center, Worcester, MA.

4. Altshuller, G.S. (1991) *To Find an Idea: Introduction to the Theory of Inventive Problem Solving*, 2nd edn. Nauka, Novosibirsk.

### Masters' and PhD Theses on TRIZ. 
These are good especially for the overview of many problem-solving techniques in the intro chapters. 


1. Roni Horowitz.(May 1999). Phd Thesis, Tel Aviv University.[*Creative Problem Solving in Engineering*.](https://asit.info/Creative%20Problem%20Solving%20in%20Engineering%20Design,%20thesis%20by%20Roni%20Horowitz.pdf). 
Very readable. Introduction Chapters are especially very good. He derives his technique of **ASIT** from TRIZ in this PhD Thesis. Some terrific TRIZ examples in here, which are analyzed as part of my <u>[TRIZ Database.](/slides/PlayAndInvent/TRIZ-Database/index.html)</u>


1. Chhabin Pokhrel. *ADAPTATION OF TRIZ METHOD FOR PROBLEM
SOLVING IN PROCESS ENGINEERING*. LAPPEENRANTA UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY, Faculty of Technology. <u>[PDF](TRIZ-related/Adaptation of TRIZ Method for Problem Solving in Process Engineering by Pokhrel Chhabin.pdf)</u>
